get_scene_info:
Get the current scene state.

üîç ESSENTIAL FIRST STEP: Always call this function BEFORE any other operations to understand what currently exists in the scene.

Returns:
- All nodes with their auto-generated IDs and positions
- All members with their auto-generated IDs and connected nodes
- All boundary conditions
- All loads

Use the returned IDs in subsequent operations - never assume or guess IDs.
add_nodes:
Add nodes to the scene.

‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL PREREQUISITE: You MUST call get_scene_info() FIRST to check existing nodes and understand the current scene state.

IMPORTANT NOTES:
- Y-axis is vertical (Y-up coordinate system)
- Node IDs are AUTO-GENERATED by the system
- After adding nodes, call get_scene_info() again to retrieve the generated IDs

WORKFLOW:
1. Call get_scene_info() to see existing nodes and avoid duplicates
2. Add new nodes with this function
3. Call get_scene_info() to get the auto-generated node IDs for use in subsequent operations
add_members:
Add members to the scene.

‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL PREREQUISITE: You MUST call get_scene_info() FIRST to retrieve the actual node IDs that exist in the scene. Never assume node IDs - they are auto-generated.

WORKFLOW:
1. Call get_scene_info() to see existing nodes
2. Use the actual node.id values from the response for nodei and nodej parameters
3. Then call this function with those IDs

Member IDs are also AUTO-GENERATED. Call get_scene_info() after adding members to retrieve their IDs for use with loads.
add_bc:
Apply boundary conditions to the nodes.

‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL PREREQUISITE: You MUST call get_scene_info() FIRST to retrieve the actual node IDs that exist in the scene.

WORKFLOW:
1. Call get_scene_info() to see existing nodes
2. Use the actual node.id values from the response for the targets parameter
3. Then call this function with those node IDs

NEVER use assumed or guessed node IDs - always get them from get_scene_info().
add_linear_load:
Apply linear loads to the members.

‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL PREREQUISITE: You MUST call get_scene_info() FIRST to retrieve the actual member IDs that exist in the scene.

IMPORTANT NOTES:
- Y-axis is vertical (Y-up coordinate system)
- Member IDs are AUTO-GENERATED when members are created

WORKFLOW:
1. Call get_scene_info() to see existing members
2. Use the actual member.id values from the response for the targets parameter
3. Then call this function with those member IDs

NEVER use assumed or guessed member IDs - always get them from get_scene_info().
